He didn't retract his ladder before ascent from the Mun and he didn't retract his landing gear either. That's just sloppy piloting, toes or no toes

Seriously though, that was pretty cool. Makes me think back to how big a deal it was to land on the Mun for the first time, and how trivial it seems to do so now. Don't get discouraged, young Kerbonauts - some day you too will be able to do it with your hands tied behind your back!

MANLEY MODE WITH YOUR TOES

Abyssal mode, SpaceSphereOfDeath.

Now all he has to do is go to Minmus and back without the map screen or hands, using only solid boosters, and without rotating the craft at all.

Apparently I've been doing it wrong the whole time...

Landing on the moon in 4 easy steps:

1. Get some dashing socks

2. Toss back a couple.

3. ???

4. Profit!

BTW, landing on Minmus is just as easy, actually. You spend about 60 more Dv to get there, but about 100 less Dv between insertion and landing.
I think we have just ended up with our foot in our mouths... who knew, all this time, it was better to have your foot on the keyboard.

BTW, landing on Minmus is just as easy, actually. You spend about 60 more Dv to get there, but about 100 less Dv between insertion and landing.

Yes, but accounting for the inclination without map mode, and only being able to use high thrust boosters in the low gravity. I suppose it would be harder if he hadn't already had some practice doing just that.
